comment: took his 8am lecture and this guy had the jokes, talk to him like a friend and get on good terms with ole boy and you will be fine, loves cocktails, blue ridge, cars and hunting

WORST AND MEANEST teacher at Kennesaw. He is not understanding at all, picks favorites and will only treat those students with kindness and through explanation. Tests are stupid long. HUGE group project and it has a lot of components so get ready. WORST TEACHER EVER.
rating_tags: Participation matters--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Love this guy! Very personable and very professional! Will relate to college level humor. Chapter notes are posted too d2l. He is willing to help if u ask.  Big outdoorsman and car guy, relate on that level and you will be on good terms! Go to class he makes it worth while.

Yes, his class is difficult. Every Consumer Behavior class requires a lot of work, so get over it. Blog post each week(easy), 3 blog essays, smartbooks, and a large group project. Only tests are midterm and final. He can be pretty funny, very knowledgeable and will answer questions. Attendance is a grade, but your paying for college, show up.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Lots of homework

comment: Assignment directions make no sense, hardest grader I have ever had in college, would not recommend for anyone.

Professor Serkedakis was a great in-person choice. His lectures are educational and class usually got out early. There's lots of homework and a weekly discussion post that is easy to forget. The group project is large but very manageable. He was sometimes randomly rude when giving feedback online. I feel bad for online students. Take him in person!

I'm not a big fan of the professor as he was not communicative with students. Provided little instruction/feedback, but the course itself is interesting. Whole course was a group project and 3 tests. Project is interesting and easy to meet due dates, but tests are difficult as he essentially created all the course material and wrote the book.

Like clear grading rubrics? Don't expect much from Mr. Serkedakis. He gives loose outlines of what he expects and then grades your work as he feels in the moment. Missed a comma? -10 points. Condescending comments, always with a :) at the end. Powerpoints are from 2008. He tells you to proofread your work but does not do so himself. Don't take him.

I had Serkedakis in person in fall 21. I loved him and his teaching style so I took him again this spring. Well, the transition for him is like day & night. When I reached out for help or had a question, he would make some snarky comment or be extremely rude in his response. Highly recommend in person classes for him, or just take another professor
Hypocritical. He really emphasizes spelling and grammar but nearly all his assignments have errors in them. Dont take him online

The class is not one of the show up and pass classes but if you put in a little work and you try you will pass the class easy! Attendance was not a grade but his lectures were good and we got out early almost every class. The assignments are not hard, and tests are not bad. Group project is not bad either since he has due dates all throughout.

Professor Serkedakis is one of the best professors I have had in college. He makes sure you learn the material by showing up to class and applying it to today's world. The classes are not miserable and he changes them up so they are not the same every time. He is overall a great guy with great intentions!

The course itself is right, but Professor Serkedakis is condescending and petty. He even put a "haha" in one of the test instructions where we couldn't use online resources. The course consists of semester-long group assignments and projects, 3 written assignments, 3 tests with lockdown browser w/ camera. Avoid him unless you have to take the class.

I took him online and based on reading other feedback that seems to make a big difference with this guy. There was an absurd amount of work and they were all due on random days so I could never keep track. The work itself was fairly easy once you understood what he was asking for but figuring out his verbiage was difficult. VERY CONDESCENDING.

Took him online due to the pandemic, and it had way too many assignments, IMO (wasn't difficult conceptually). 20 LearnSmarts that were 70-80+ questions each, 20 quizzes, 2 exams, 15 consumer blog journals, 3 essays, and a group project with several deadlines prior to turning in the finished product. If this class is online in S/S '21, AVOID.

He has a great background in sales and marketing. He's knowledgeable about the program so he's willing to help with Cole's related stuff. This class was great because he brought in companies for us to create IMC plans for. It was the most hands-on class i've ever had. He helped us a lot with the switch to online, even though it was already online.
lectures are boring. two exams (final and midterm), group project and connect quizzes. Fairly easy class.
rating_tags: Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes--Lecture heavy

comment: Took class online. Super disorganized. Would avoid taking his class online. It's been challenging and when you email him to ask him questions he's not helpful and keeps saying it takes 6-10 hours a week of work for his class. He has the wrong names of things in assignments and lectures and videos on d2l are from old semesters. Avoid this guy!
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Get ready to read--Participation matters

comment: He is trying to replicate the classroom setting into an online class and it just doesn't translate. He is very disorganized and gives conflicting information through the loads of paperwork you have to sift through in order to figure out what he wants. Very unresponsive and a frustrating online experience. Easy, if you do the work, but ridiculous.

The teacher does not provide adequate and accurate feedback on the numerous papers assigned. The workload is overwhelming for such a simple class. He has poor email etiquette, consistently misspells things, and uses improper grammar. He does not stick to the due dates outlined on the schedule and he heavily deducts points for minor errors.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Group projects--Beware of pop quizzes

comment: Here is what you can expect... 4 Tests and a Group Project (Semester-Long) with various assignments due throughout the semester. Lectures are over powerpoints, but I enjoyed Professor Serkedakis's humor so it wasn't bad at all. I definitely recommend. 5 Star.

Throughout my college career I have never experience such a rude and arrogant professor. He speaks to students in a manner that is NEVER necessary. Instructions are never completed, NEVER completed. Do not think you can get ahead of the class because instructions can change very quickly.  Do not take this professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--GROUP PROJECTS

comment: Very rude and arrogant. He's not understanding to life. Don't miss an assignment or he will fail you and not respect you whatsoever. i apologized in an appropriate manner and let him know it was inexcusable and he was nothing but rude. He never replied to any of my emails I sent him throughout the course until this.

This class was almost entirely group based. There were a few short papers and tests, but everything else was completed in preassigned groups.  Not hard to get an A, but your grade will ultimately be determined by your luck in the random group draw. Lectures can be somewhat boring, but sometimes he will sprinkle in some interesting facts or stories.

Professor Serkedakis seemed uninterested and unprepared during class. His lectures were boring. He wasn't approachable or willing to help/clarify when I had questions. Study everything in red on PP for tests. Don't buy his book; it isn't necessary. Overall, the class has been easy, but I wouldn't take this professor again.
Good professor - seems to really care about his students being successful. Was not a harsh grader, but wanted you to understand the process of selling. I would take him again.

Hands down the BEST professor I have ever had. He likes you as long as you aren't a slacker. Work hard and you'll do fine in the class. Attendance is taken and can be used for extra credit, so go! His class is enjoyable, he is hilarious and loves talking about his interests. Don't make the stupid mistake of not taking him- you can thank me later
Do the work and keep up. This is not a class you have time to repeat! YOU DO NOT HAVE TIME TO REPEAT A ZERO CREDIT HOUR COURSE.
Excellent teacher! Easy to listen to and always lets class out early to work on the group projects! Everything is straight forward and it is easy to make an A!

Awesome teacher. took pro selling online which i don't think he does anymore. Very helpful. Tests are easy. Scripted role play conversations with partner are fun and simulate real life experiences. He wants to help you and cares about you. fun to interact with. He is one of the bet teacher at KSU and I wish every student could take this guy.

The test are very long and he gives you very limited time to take them.  Hard to get a great grade on tests.  He doesn't give very clear instructions on the marketing plan.  You pretty much have to figure it out on your own.

I took Mktg 4666 online and found this class to be a surprisingly difficult elective - particularly the tests. The tests are long and you have very limited time to complete them. Tests have to be taken in Lockdown. Be sure to write a lot in the essay questions because he grades them very hard. Final was over 550 power points slides!!

He was a great professor! Dont buy the book because he pretty much tells you what's going to be on tests in his ppts. Very funny and entertaining man. Learned a lot. The tests were pretty easy. If you can find someone who has the test from the previous semester, the answers are identical in nearly the same order. Project wasnt too difficult either.

Love Professor Serkedakis!  He's funny, easy to listen to, an helpful!  He answers questions and emails quickly and respectfully, and is willing to help.  Study just a bit, work hard on the project, and you'll do fine!

First, DO NOT BUY THE BOOK... waste of money because you will NEVER use it. He takes attendance everyday.  Don't wait until the last minute to start project and don't be afraid to kick a group member out when he gives you the chance. EASY A, if you do your work and study a day before the test.

His teaches lecture style he goes over the power points everything thats in RED will be on the test. You will be placed in teams for your MKTG project. The overall project isn't difficult just make sure you work on it all semester. Don't wait till the last minute to complete the 37pg Marketing plan.  His test are easy some T/F & mult. choice.
Smart, funny guy who makes learning the principles of marketing bearable. Take him.
Expectations are unclear. Gives busy work. Talks way too much about his personal life/wives. Reads ppts. Over half of the class leaves after signing in.

Serkedakis is the man. I learned quite a bit about how to sell, but more about confidence in the business world. Quizzes in the 1st half of the semester and then role plays until the end. If you go to class and give a good effort, you will make an A. No final. One of the greatest professors at KSU
This class was easy. He goes through the power points and everything in red are on the test... He does change it up sometimes so go to class.. Don't buy the book cause you will never use it

Great teacher. Cares about students. Look at the red in the ppts and listen to what he says. The hardest part of the class was the group project only because some people slack off. But that is life. Don't buy the book because you wont use it. TAKE HIM
What you read on the previous posts is exactly true. AWESOME PROFESSOR!!!! Come to class and study the notes in RED and you will get an A.

Oh yea!! Professor Serkedakis ROCKS! He comes from the real life sales business so that's all you'll get from him. He used to make a ton of money in sales/as a sales manager and retired young. TAKE HIM, YOU WON'T REGRET IT! 3100: remember everything in red for easy A on exams, 1 big project. 4410: Easy role plays, no tests, easy online quizzes

Mr. Serkadakis is a great professor! The class was almost always interesting and we always had a great time.  You need to come to class everyday but if your like me, this class will wind up being one you look forward to going to anyways!  TAKE MR. SERKADAKIS IN ANY CLASS YOU CAN!

I had heard a lot of good things about professor Serkedakis before taking this class and I can say they are all true.  Great Teacher, Funny and has experienced everything he teaches.  Hardest part is the project if the team you have to work with isn't worth a crap. NO REFLECTION ON THE PROFESSOR!

Probably the easiest class I've ever taken. I hate presentations & speaking in public but this class is soooo easy. I wouldn't recommend buying the book, you only use it a handful of times. Absolutely no tests, just role plays, some quizzes. The 1st half of the semester is spent in the class room and the 2nd is watching your classmate's roleplays.

The material we learned in class was clear and the questions on tests were a good reflection of what we learned in class. Only qualms I have are 1) 100 question tests are pretty long, and 2) some questions were extra tricky. Overall, the professor was entertaining and I appreciated the real world examples of marketing to explain the material.

I HATE MARKETING...this was an easy class.  Got an A.  Never used the book, study what is in red on the power points and the study guides.  2 exams 100 questions each, 1 comprehensive final 100 questions...3 short article papers, and 1 group project.  He takes attendance every class.  Funny guy, great stories..fairly easy, go to class.

Awesome prof, funny guy! Don't buy the book (I say this after buying it for $120 and never having to use it...) and study all material in red. He also tells you what to study as he goes thru the powerpoint. Funny guy...will def keep you awake in class.

Attendance is mandatory but class is a BLAST! I LOVE Prof. Serk. He is the sweetest guy and very funny. Pay attention to the "RED" material in the ppt's and tests are easy A's. Don't need the book at all, didn't open it even once. TAKE HIS CLASS!!

first off: DO NOT BUY THE BOOK!Ok now that that is out of the way, he is pretty cool. the tests can be a challenge and so can the project, but they are very doable with some effort. dont slack and you should come out with a solid A or B

Not a bad teacher, or class. He goes over everything pretty good with a touch of humor. The group project kinda sucked, but don't they always.It wasn't that bad, I had cool group members. Don't buy the book!
Serkedakis is one of the best.  He is a must take for anyone that needs Marketing 3100.  This guy has been successful in everything he has done and it definitely transfers over into his teaching.

I had NO interest in marketing before this class. He was awesome and made things very fun. He tells great jokes also. The power points were not helpful to me. When I studied for the tests I read the chapter summaries after each chapter. Tests are a little tricky so make sure you study.
great teacher.  don't buy the book. study all the red things on the power points thats whats on the test.
Nice professor, fun class, very helpful study guides.

As others have mentioned, pay particular attention to anything highlighted in RED on the powerpoints in preparation for the tests.  Some of the questions are tricky - you still need to know the material and how to apply it to get the right answer.  Very nice fellow with tons of real-world experience.

Fun class, during the semester we covered all the chapters from the book, a lot of material to study but his power point presentations help to narrow it down, I spent lots of time preparing for the final but it paid back, come to class and prepare assigned articles

Easiest class I think I have ever taken. I wanted to take him again but I don't think he teaches other courses. All test Qs come from the red writing in the ppts, unless he straight up gives you the chapter study guide which has the test qs for that chapter, word for word. If you want to answer the bonus qs you need the book, thats it.
No need to buy the text book, just study his PPT esp. everything in RED and you are good to go. Very funny and great guy. Jokes a round more than anything and makes this dry subject fun.
Mike is a good teacher.  Lectures, Project, and Articles are very easy to complete.  This is an Easy A...Take Mike Serkedakis...
mike is the best teacher ive had at ksu.

If you fail this class going to school will not help you in your future. Lays out everything you need to get an A in the class. If you do your work you get an A. About 1/3 of test questions are given in practice worksheets and everything else if from the lecture (You still need to read the book). A lot of info, but manageable. Mike is great!

Easy going professor, relates material to real life, do all the articles, which are very simple, and the group project. Exams are multiple choice, however there are a lot of questions 100-150, but is an easy A or B.

this guy is really cool.  he makes jokes and relates the material to real life events and personal events from his past.  the material is pretty hard though and you have to study a lot for the tests.  the only work you have to do is the articles and a group project.  it's a good class.  challenging but fun.

Do not believe what some are writing abt his tests. Yeah they are not the hardest, but if ure not a mktng major, like me, u prolly wanna study maybe abt. 3hrs on tests, that will give u a low B. He adds about 20 tricky questions that are really confusing. 5articles, an easy A and fun project. but for mktng haard tests. got a B, and didnt buy book
read from power points, but highlights info in powerpoints that will be tested on...gives several "gimme" ?s before test for u to know that will definitely be on exam...overall pretty good teacher.
he is a very good teacher. However, the best advice for taking his class is to make sure you each and every new article for his class.

Really nice & easy-going professor! Tells u exactly what to expect on the test & even gives u 10-20 question dat will be on the test. Finals can be rough...150 MC questions but study ur 1st 2 exams & the ppt & u'll be fine.

Probably one of the best teachers at Kennesaw University. Very helpful and nice...gives real world examples of the material covered. I would advise to skim the chapter when studying for exams...even though material is from the PPs. At the end of semester helps out the extra point if needed. Have a group presentation...which is very easy. Got an A+

Serkedakis does not teach for the most part, he reads word-for-word from a PowerPoint Presentation and throws in a few anecdotes. His tests are from the PPTs. Basically, the class is one big PPT seminar,just know how to extract what you need for the test and you should be fine. 1/2 the class didn't show up on the 2nd day it was so boring.
